s.gd: Bha Raonaid na seasamh aig a’ bhòrd ag iarnaigeadh is a h-inntinn a’ ruith air rudan eile — no innse na fìrinn air aon rud agus air aon neach.
s.en: Rachel was stood at the table ironing and her mind running on other things – or to tell the truth on one thing and on one person.

s.gd: Bha na sgoileirean a’ tighinn dhachaigh an latha sin airson làithean-saora an t-samhraidh.
s.en: The scholars were coming home that day for the summer holidays.

s.gd: Saoil am biodh cùisean eadar i-fhèin is Ruairidh Alasdair Aonghais cho inntinneach ’s a bha iad aig a’ Chàisg.
s.en: She wondered whether things between herself and Derek Alexander Angus would be as interesting as they had been at Easter.

s.gd: No ’m biodh t’èile air tighinn eatorra.
s.en: Or would another woman have come between them.

s.gd: Gheall i-fhèin is Ruairidh sgrìobhadh gu chèile nuair dh’fhalbh e ach cha tàinig bhuaithe ach an aon sgrìobag agus ged fhreagair ise i gu luath cha d’fhuair i freagairt fhathast.
s.en: Herself and Derek had promised to write to each other when he had left but only one scribble had come from him and even though she had replied to it quickly she had not received a response yet.

s.gd: Gun teagamh chunnaic i e nuair bha iad air an t-slighe Ghlaschu.
s.en: Without doubt she had seen him when they were on the way to Glasgow.

s.gd: Thainig e chun an stèisein ann an Inbhir Nis ga faicinn fhad sa bha an trèan na stad greiseag an sin ach cha robh e leis fhèin.
s.en: He had come to the station in Inverness to see her while the train was stopped for a while there but he was not by himself.

s.gd: Bha Mòrag bheag Dhòmhnaill Uilleim còmhla ris.
s.en: Little Morag Donald William was with him.

s.gd: Mas fhìor gu robh ise cho feumach air a faicinn cuideachd!
s.en: As if she were as needful of seeing her too!

s.gd: Huh!
Bha, cho feumach nach biodh ùine aig an dithis eile còmhla.
s.en: Yes, as needy that the two others would not have time together.

s.gd: Bha nòisean a tòineadh aice do Ruairidh.
s.en: A notion ...

s.gd: Robh Mòrag bheag a’ smaoineachadh gu robh ise, Raonaid, dall?
s.en: Was little Morag thinking that she, Rachel, was blind?

s.gd: Nach robh i faicinn na sùilean a bha i dèanamh ri Ruairidh.
s.en: Was she not seeing in her eyes that she was doing to Derek.

s.gd: Is mar bha i tòiseachadh ri bruidhinn air gnothaichean mun sgoil a h-uile cothrom a gheibheadh i agus Raonaid a’ feuchainn ri bruidhinn ri Ruairidh mu dè bha dol aig an taigh.
s.en: And as she was starting to talk about things to do with school, every opportunity that she and Rachel would get trying to talk to Derek about what was going on at the house.

s.gd: Bha Raonaid air an sgoil fhàgail a’ bhliadhna roimhe sin gus greiseag a chur seachad aig an taigh mus tòisicheadh i ri nursadh.
s.en: Rachel had left the school the year before that in order to spend some time at home before she would start nursing.

s.gd: Agus ged bha i titheach gu leòr air cluinntinn mun fheadhainn a b’ aithne dhi ’s mu na tidsearan ’s ann shaoileadh tu air Mòrag nach robh gnothach aicese riutha ’s gur ann a bha seo eadar i-fhèin is Ruairidh.
s.en: And even though she was eager enough to hear about those people she knew and about the teachers, you would think on Morag that she that no business with them and that this was between herself and Derek.

s.gd: Agus a-nis seall thusa ’n ùine a bha Ruairidh aig Mòrag dhi fhèin.
s.en: And now you will see the time that Morag had Derek to herself.

s.gd: ’Sann a bha seòrsa de aithreachas air Raonaid nach do thill i bliadhn’ eile dhan sgoil.
s.en: There was a kind of remorse on Rachel that she had not returned for another year to the school.

s.gd: Agus gus dragh ceart a chur oirre bha i air litir fhaighinn o Mhòrag bheag an latha sin fhèin mas fhìor a ràdh gun tigeadh i nall a choimhead oirre a chiad weekend aig an taigh ach bha litir làn de Ruairidh.
s.en: And to put true worry on her, she had received a letter from little Morag that very day allegedly saying that she would come over to see her the first weekend at home but it was a letter full of Derek.

s.gd: Ruairidh siud, ’s Ruairidh seo, Ruairidh aig na Sports, Ruairidh aig danns na sgoile, Ruairidh anns a’ chlass-room.
s.en: Derek there, and Derek here, Derek at the Sports, Derek at the school dance, Derek in the classroom.

s.gd: Agus thuigeadh tu ge be air bith càit am biodh Ruairidh bhiodh Mòrag!
s.en: And you would understand that wherever Derek was would be Morag!

s.gd: Chan e mhàin gu robh Ruairidh aice dhi fhèin fad na bliadhna anns an sgoil ach bha iad a’ fuireach anns an aon bhaile cuideachd — ochd mìle air falbh.
s.en: It was not only that Derek had been hers all to herself all year in the school, but they were living in the same town as well – eight miles apart.

s.gd: Carson ma bha Raonaid na caraid cho mòr aice nach do dh’iarr i oirre dhol a-null ’n àit ise bhith tighinn a-nall a’ chiad chothrom?
s.en: Why if Racehl was such a great friend of hers did she not ask her to go over there instead of her coming over here the first opportunity?

s.gd: Agus bha P.S. anns an litir cuideachd.
s.en: And there was a P.S. in the letter as well.

s.gd: “Tha mi air fios fhaighinn gu bheil mi faighinn a-staigh dhan University.
s.en: “I have received knowledge that I am getting in to the University.

s.gd: Tha Ruairidh e-fhèin a’ dol ann.
s.en: Derek is going there himself.

s.gd: An robh fhios agad?”
s.en: Did you know?”

s.gd: ’S math bha fhios aice nach robh.
s.en: It is good that she knew that didn’t.

s.gd: Cò bha dol ga innse dhi?
s.en: Who was going to tell it to her?

s.gd: Robh Mòrag a’ smuaineachadh gu robh University a’ sgrìobhadh gu Raonaid a dh’innse dhi cò bha iad a’ taghadh is cò nach robh!
s.en: Was Morag thinking that a University was writing to Rachel to tell her who they were choosing and who not!

s.gd: “Raonaid a ghaoil,” chual i màthair ag èigheachd às an sgularaidh, “tha crodh a’ nochdadh agus tha banachagan a’ cheann shìos seachad a sin.
s.en: “Rachel darling,” she heard her mother calling from the scullery, “cattle are appearing and the milkmaids in charge are down past there.

s.gd: ’S fheàrr dhut falbh.
s.en: You should leave.

s.gd: Crìochnaichidh mi-fhèin an t-iarnaigeadh.”
s.en: I will finish the ironing myself.”

s.gd: Tharraing Raonaid oirre na Wellingtons agus thug i peil is siuga mach às a’ phreasa.
s.en: Rachel pulled on her Wellingtons and she took a pail and jug out of the press.

s.gd: Bha feasgar brèagha ann.
s.en: It was a beautiful afternoon.

s.gd: Bhiodh feadhainn de na sgoileirean anns a’ gheàrraidh a-nochd.
s.en: Some of the scholars would be in the pastureland tonight.

s.gd: ’S cinnteach gu faigheadh i naidheachd air Ruairidh.
s.en: It is certain that she would get news about Derek.

s.gd: Ach nuair thill Raonaid on eadradh cha robh i ach mar a bha i roimhe.
s.en: But when Rachel returned from the milking she was just as she had been before.

s.gd: Bha gu leòr aig na sgoileirean ri ràdha gun teagamh ach cha robh air Ruairidh a bharrachd air càch.
s.en: The scholars had had enough to say without doubt but there was not more about Derek than the others.

s.gd: Agus gu dearbh cha robh ise dol a dh’fhaighneachd dad mu dheidhinn.
s.en: And indeed *she* was not going to ask anything about it.

s.gd: Bha na sgoileirean co-dhiù cho feumach iad-fhèin air naidheachdan a’ bhaile fhaotainn.
s.en: The scholars were anyway so needful themselves of getting news of the town.

s.gd: Cò bh’aig Murchadh an-dràsda;
s.en: Who was with Murdo now;

s.gd: d’fhuair Seonaidh Alasdair a licence air ais;
s.en: had Johnny Alexander got his licence back;

s.gd: cuin a bha dannsa gu bhith ann;
s.en: when was there going to be a dance;

s.gd: cuin a bha football;
s.en: when was football;

s.gd: robh guth air banais;
s.en: was there mention of a wedding;

s.gd: ’l fhios co leis a bha bàbaidh aig Seonag Eachainn;
s.en: does anyone know who Janet Hector had a baby with;

s.gd: nach e bha smodaig an loidsear a bha an taigh Eòghainn;
s.en: was he not handsome the lodger who was in Ewan’s house;

s.gd: robh dad a dh’fheum anns na saighdearan a bh’aig na rocaidean???
s.en: was anything useful in the soldiers who were at the rockets???
